result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on October 26, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 8:35am [Court Reporter: Lori Schiek]
Defendant John H. Cramer in court.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court for John H. Cramer.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Mr. Cramer waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

On Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification: 
--Arguments given by Counsel

The Court grants an exception to the no contact at the presence of Victim's residence. 
The new condition is to read: no presence at the Victim's residence, except Mr. Cramer may make a one time trip to house to retrieve belongings if divorce counsel stipulate to exact items to be removed and exact time and date items to be removed 

recess: 8:49am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/26/22 at 9:40am    (2) Status Conference on 11/28/22 at 9:30am
Defense Motion to Modify Bond

Adjourned initial appearance on July 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ml] Case called at 1:27PM
Defendant John H. Cramer appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def does not qualify). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Att Flint advises that Victim Rights Compliance has not yet achieved, but the State will comply with Victim Rights legislation within the 10 day time frame.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given by the Court. The Defendant advises that he is attempting to retain private counsel.
The Court tolls Preliminary Hearing time limits and preserves all the Defendant's jurisdictional and constitutional objections, and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance.

The Court requires a $100,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1 or Victim 2 as referred to in the Criminal Compliant and Victim/Witness Key
--no presence at the Victims' residence, with the exception that the Defendant may have a one time visit to retrieve personal belongings. If the time to do so take smore than 15 to 20 minutes, then the Defendant must make arrangments with an off duty police officer at his own expense. Defendant may only take items that undisputedly belong to him; any item that is in dispute shall be left at the residence and shall be subject to the civil process
--no unsupervised contact with any minor
--not leave the State of Wisconsin
--surrender any passport to the Clerk of Court's Office for the duration of the proceedings of this case; the passport is to be surrendered within 24 hours of the Defendant signing the signature bond

recess 1:37PM

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 07/14 at 1:15PM with in person appearance
